content: 1 Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, A called apostle, Separated unto the glad-message of God—
content_old: 1 Paul, a servant of Jesus Christ, A called apostle, Separated unto the glad-message of God—

content: 2 Which he promised beforehand､ through his prophets､ in holy scriptures—
content_old: 2 Which he promised beforehand､ through his prophets､ in holy scriptures—

content: 3 Concerning his Son,— Who came to be of the seed of David､ according to flesh,
content_old: 3 Concerning his Son,— Who came to be of the seed of David､ according to flesh,

content: 4 Who was distinguished as the Son of God— By power､ According to a Holy Spirit､ Through means of a resurrection of the dead,— Jesus Christ our Lord;
content_old: 4 Who was distinguished as the Son of God— By power､ According to a Holy Spirit､ Through means of a resurrection of the dead,— Jesus Christ our Lord;

content: 5 Through whom we have received favour and apostleship, For obedience of faith among all the nations､ in behalf of his name,
content_old: 5 Through whom we have received favour and apostleship, For obedience of faith among all the nations､ in behalf of his name,

content: 6 Among whom are ye also called of Jesus Christ:
content_old: 6 Among whom are ye also called of Jesus Christ:

content: 7 Unto all that are in Rome､ beloved of God､ called saints Favour unto you､ and peace､ From God our Father and Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 7 Unto all that are in Rome､ beloved of God､ called saints Favour unto you､ and peace､ From God our Father and Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 8 First indeed､ I give thanks unto my God､ through Jesus Christ､ concerning you all, Because your faith is being announced throughout the whole world.
content_old: 8 First indeed､ I give thanks unto my God､ through Jesus Christ､ concerning you all, Because your faith is being announced throughout the whole world.

content: 9 For God is my witness— Unto whom I am rendering divine service in my spirit､ in the glad message of his Son— How incessantly I am making mention of you
content_old: 9 For God is my witness— Unto whom I am rendering divine service in my spirit､ in the glad message of his Son— How incessantly I am making mention of you

content: 10 at all times in my prayers,— Making supplication— If by some means､ even now､ at any time I may have a way opened､ in the will of God､ to come unto you;
content_old: 10 at all times in my prayers,— Making supplication— If by some means､ even now､ at any time I may have a way opened､ in the will of God､ to come unto you;

content: 11 For I am longing to see you, That I may impart some spiritual gift unto you, To the end ye may be established,—
content_old: 11 For I am longing to see you, That I may impart some spiritual gift unto you, To the end ye may be established,—

content: 12 That is to say—There may be a mutual encouragement among you, Each by the other’s faith, Both yours and mine.
content_old: 12 That is to say—There may be a mutual encouragement among you, Each by the other’s faith, Both yours and mine.

content: 13 I do not wish､ however that ye should be ignorant､ brethren､ That many times have I purposed to come unto you, But have been hindered､ until the present,— In order that some fruit I might have among you also､ even as among the other nations
content_old: 13 I do not wish､ however that ye should be ignorant､ brethren､ That many times have I purposed to come unto you, But have been hindered､ until the present,— In order that some fruit I might have among you also､ even as among the other nations

content: 14 Both to Greeks and to Barbarians, Both to wise and to unwise a debtor I am:
content_old: 14 Both to Greeks and to Barbarians, Both to wise and to unwise a debtor I am:

content: 15 Thus the eagerness on my part— Unto you also who are in Rome To announce the joyful message.
content_old: 15 Thus the eagerness on my part— Unto you also who are in Rome To announce the joyful message.

content: 16 For I am not ashamed of the joyful message; For it is God’s power unto salvation､ to every one that believeth, Both to Jew first and to Greek;
content_old: 16 For I am not ashamed of the joyful message; For it is God’s power unto salvation､ to every one that believeth, Both to Jew first and to Greek;

content: 17 For a righteousness of God is therein､ revealed,— By faith unto faith: Even as it is written— But he that is righteous by faith shall live.
content_old: 17 For a righteousness of God is therein､ revealed,— By faith unto faith: Even as it is written— But he that is righteous by faith shall live.

content: 18 For there is being revealed an anger of God from heaven— Against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men Who the truth､ in unrighteousness do hold down;—
content_old: 18 For there is being revealed an anger of God from heaven— Against all ungodliness and unrighteousness of men Who the truth､ in unrighteousness do hold down;—

content: 19 Inasmuch as what may be known of God is manifest among them, For God unto them hath made it manifest,—
content_old: 19 Inasmuch as what may be known of God is manifest among them, For God unto them hath made it manifest,—

content: 20 For the unseen things of him from a world’s creation By the things made being perceived Are clearly seen, Even his eternal power and divinity,— To the end they should be without excuse;
content_old: 20 For the unseen things of him from a world’s creation By the things made being perceived Are clearly seen, Even his eternal power and divinity,— To the end they should be without excuse;

content: 21 Inasmuch as having come to know God Not as God did they glorify him､ or give him thanks, But were made fruitless in their reasonings､ And darkened was their undiscerning heart,
content_old: 21 Inasmuch as having come to know God Not as God did they glorify him､ or give him thanks, But were made fruitless in their reasonings､ And darkened was their undiscerning heart,

content: 22 Professing to be wise they were made foolish､
content_old: 22 Professing to be wise they were made foolish､

content: 23 And exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God､ for the likeness of an image of a corruptible man､ and of birds and fourfooted beasts and reptiles:
content_old: 23 And exchanged the glory of the incorruptible God､ for the likeness of an image of a corruptible man､ and of birds and fourfooted beasts and reptiles:

content: 24 Wherefore God gave them up in the covetings of their hearts､ unto impurity, so as to be dishonouring their bodies among them,—
content_old: 24 Wherefore God gave them up in the covetings of their hearts､ unto impurity, so as to be dishonouring their bodies among them,—

content: 25 Who､ indeed､ exchanged away the truth of God for the falsehood､ And rendered worship and service unto the creature rather than unto the Creator,— Who is blessed unto the ages. Amen!
content_old: 25 Who､ indeed､ exchanged away the truth of God for the falsehood､ And rendered worship and service unto the creature rather than unto the Creator,— Who is blessed unto the ages. Amen!

content: 26 For this cause God gave them up unto dishonourable passions; For even their females exchanged away the natural use into that which is against nature,—
content_old: 26 For this cause God gave them up unto dishonourable passions; For even their females exchanged away the natural use into that which is against nature,—

content: 27 In like manner also even the males, Leaving the natural use of the female Flamed out in their eager desire one for another, Males with males the indecency effecting,— And the necessary recompence of their error within themselves duly receiving;—
content_old: 27 In like manner also even the males, Leaving the natural use of the female Flamed out in their eager desire one for another, Males with males the indecency effecting,— And the necessary recompence of their error within themselves duly receiving;—

content: 28 And even as they did not approve to be holding God in acknowledgment God gave them up unto a disapproved mind､ To be doing the things that are not becoming,—
content_old: 28 And even as they did not approve to be holding God in acknowledgment God gave them up unto a disapproved mind､ To be doing the things that are not becoming,—

content: 29 Filled with all unrighteousness､ wickedness､ greed､ baseness, Full of envy､ murder､ strife､ deceit､ evil disposition,
content_old: 29 Filled with all unrighteousness､ wickedness､ greed､ baseness, Full of envy､ murder､ strife､ deceit､ evil disposition,

content: 30 Whisperers､ detractors､ haters of God､ insolent､ arrogant､ vain boasters､ inventors of vices､ unto parents unyielding,
content_old: 30 Whisperers､ detractors､ haters of God､ insolent､ arrogant､ vain boasters､ inventors of vices､ unto parents unyielding,

content: 31 Without discernment､ regardless of covenants､ without natural affection､ unmerciful:—
content_old: 31 Without discernment､ regardless of covenants､ without natural affection､ unmerciful:—

content: 1 Wherefore inexcusable thou art, O man whoever judgest; For wherein thou judgest some one else thyself thou dost condemn,— For the very things thou dost practise who art judging:
content_old: 1 Wherefore inexcusable thou art, O man whoever judgest; For wherein thou judgest some one else thyself thou dost condemn,— For the very things thou dost practise who art judging:

content: 2 We know､ however､ that the sentence of God is according to truth､ against them who such things as these do practise.
content_old: 2 We know､ however､ that the sentence of God is according to truth､ against them who such things as these do practise.

content: 3 And reckonest thou this､ O man— Who dost judge them who such things do practise､ and yet art doing the same That thou shalt escape the sentence of God?
content_old: 3 And reckonest thou this､ O man— Who dost judge them who such things do practise､ and yet art doing the same That thou shalt escape the sentence of God?

content: 4 Or the riches of his kindness､ and forbearance､ and long-suffering dost thou despise,— Not knowing that the kindness of God unto repentance is leading thee?
content_old: 4 Or the riches of his kindness､ and forbearance､ and long-suffering dost thou despise,— Not knowing that the kindness of God unto repentance is leading thee?

content: 5 But according to thy hardness､ and thine impenitent heart Art treasuring up for thyself anger､ in a day of anger and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,—
content_old: 5 But according to thy hardness､ and thine impenitent heart Art treasuring up for thyself anger､ in a day of anger and revelation of the righteous judgment of God,—

content: 6 Who will render unto each one according to his works:—
content_old: 6 Who will render unto each one according to his works:—

content: 7 Unto them､ on the one hand､ who by way of endurance in good work are seeking glory､ honour and incorruption life age-abiding,
content_old: 7 Unto them､ on the one hand､ who by way of endurance in good work are seeking glory､ honour and incorruption life age-abiding,

content: 8 Unto them､ on the other hand､ who are of contention､ and are not yielding unto the truth､ but are yielding unto unrighteousness anger and wrath､
content_old: 8 Unto them､ on the other hand､ who are of contention､ and are not yielding unto the truth､ but are yielding unto unrighteousness anger and wrath､

content: 9 tribulation and anguish—against every soul of man who worketh out what is base, Both of Jew first and of Greek,—
content_old: 9 tribulation and anguish—against every soul of man who worketh out what is base, Both of Jew first and of Greek,—

content: 10 But glory and honour and peace—Unto every one who worketh what is good, Both unto Jew first and unto Greek:
content_old: 10 But glory and honour and peace—Unto every one who worketh what is good, Both unto Jew first and unto Greek:

content: 11 For there is no respect of persons with God;—
content_old: 11 For there is no respect of persons with God;—

content: 12 For as many as without law sinned Without law also shall perish, And as many as within law sinned Through law shall be judged;
content_old: 12 For as many as without law sinned Without law also shall perish, And as many as within law sinned Through law shall be judged;

content: 13 For not the hearers of law are righteous with God, But the doers of law shall be declared righteous;—
content_old: 13 For not the hearers of law are righteous with God, But the doers of law shall be declared righteous;—

content: 14 For whensoever the nations which have not law by nature､ the things of the law may be doing the same not having law unto themselves are a law,—
content_old: 14 For whensoever the nations which have not law by nature､ the things of the law may be doing the same not having law unto themselves are a law,—

content: 15 Who indeed､ shew the work of the law written in their hearts, Their conscience therewith bearing witness､ And between one another their reasonings accusing—or even excusing them:—
content_old: 15 Who indeed､ shew the work of the law written in their hearts, Their conscience therewith bearing witness､ And between one another their reasonings accusing—or even excusing them:—

content: 16 In the day on which God judgeth the secrets of men according to my glad-message､ through Christ Jesus.
content_old: 16 In the day on which God judgeth the secrets of men according to my glad-message､ through Christ Jesus.

content: 17 If､ however､ thou art taking the name of Jew､ And resting thyself upon law､ And boasting in God,
content_old: 17 If､ however､ thou art taking the name of Jew､ And resting thyself upon law､ And boasting in God,

content: 18 And art taking note of his will､ And testing the things that differ—when receiving oral instruction out of the law,
content_old: 18 And art taking note of his will､ And testing the things that differ—when receiving oral instruction out of the law,

content: 19 Art persuaded､ moreover､ that thou thyself art—A guide of the blind､ A light of them that are in darkness､
content_old: 19 Art persuaded､ moreover､ that thou thyself art—A guide of the blind､ A light of them that are in darkness､

content: 20 A trainer of the simple､ A teacher of babes, Having the forming of knowledge and truth in the law—
content_old: 20 A trainer of the simple､ A teacher of babes, Having the forming of knowledge and truth in the law—

content: 21 Thou､ therefore､ that art teaching someone else Thyself art thou not teaching? Thou that proclaimest—Do not steal! Art thou stealing?
content_old: 21 Thou､ therefore､ that art teaching someone else Thyself art thou not teaching? Thou that proclaimest—Do not steal! Art thou stealing?

content: 22 That sayest—Do not commit adultery! Art thou committing adultery? That abhorrest sacrilege Art thou robbing temples?
content_old: 22 That sayest—Do not commit adultery! Art thou committing adultery? That abhorrest sacrilege Art thou robbing temples?

content: 23 That in law dost boast Through the transgression of the law､ art thou dishonouring God?
content_old: 23 That in law dost boast Through the transgression of the law､ art thou dishonouring God?

content: 24 For the name of God because of you is defamed among the nations,— Even as it is written.
content_old: 24 For the name of God because of you is defamed among the nations,— Even as it is written.

content: 25 For circumcision indeed､ profiteth—if law thou be practising; But if thou be a transgressor of law thy circumcision hath become uncircumcision.
content_old: 25 For circumcision indeed､ profiteth—if law thou be practising; But if thou be a transgressor of law thy circumcision hath become uncircumcision.

content: 26 If then the uncircumcision be guarding the righteous requirement of the law Shall not his uncircumcision as circumcision be reckoned?—
content_old: 26 If then the uncircumcision be guarding the righteous requirement of the law Shall not his uncircumcision as circumcision be reckoned?—

content: 27 And the uncircumcision by nature completing the law Shall judge thee who not withstanding letter and circumcision art a transgressor of law!
content_old: 27 And the uncircumcision by nature completing the law Shall judge thee who not withstanding letter and circumcision art a transgressor of law!

content: 28 For not he who is one in appearance is a Jew, Nor is that which is such in appearance､ in flesh circumcision;
content_old: 28 For not he who is one in appearance is a Jew, Nor is that which is such in appearance､ in flesh circumcision;

content: 1 What､ then､ is the preëminence of the Jew? Or what､ the profit of his circumcision?
content_old: 1 What､ then､ is the preëminence of the Jew? Or what､ the profit of his circumcision?

content: 2 Much､ every way:— First indeed､ that they were entrusted with the oracles of God.
content_old: 2 Much､ every way:— First indeed､ that they were entrusted with the oracles of God.

content: 3 For what? If some distrusted shall their distrust make the trust of God void?
content_old: 3 For what? If some distrusted shall their distrust make the trust of God void?

content: 4 Far be it! But let God prove to be true､ albeit every man be false! Even as it is written— That thou mightest be declared righteous in thy words, And overcome when thou art in judgment.
content_old: 4 Far be it! But let God prove to be true､ albeit every man be false! Even as it is written— That thou mightest be declared righteous in thy words, And overcome when thou art in judgment.

content: 5 But if our unrighteousness commendeth God’s righteousness what shall we say? Surely not unrighteous is God who visiteth with his anger? After the manner of men I am speaking,—
content_old: 5 But if our unrighteousness commendeth God’s righteousness what shall we say? Surely not unrighteous is God who visiteth with his anger? After the manner of men I am speaking,—

content: 6 Far be it! Else how shall God judge the world?
content_old: 6 Far be it! Else how shall God judge the world?

content: 7 But if the truth of God by my falsehood hath the more abounded unto his glory Why any longer am even I as a sinner to be judged?
content_old: 7 But if the truth of God by my falsehood hath the more abounded unto his glory Why any longer am even I as a sinner to be judged?

content: 8 And why not according as we are injuriously charged､ and according as some affirm that we say Let us do the bad things､ that the good ones may come? whose sentence is just .
content_old: 8 And why not according as we are injuriously charged､ and according as some affirm that we say Let us do the bad things､ that the good ones may come? whose sentence is just .

content: 9 What then? do we screen ourselves? Not at all! For we have before accused both Jews and Greeks of being all under sin;
content_old: 9 What then? do we screen ourselves? Not at all! For we have before accused both Jews and Greeks of being all under sin;

content: 10 Even as it is written— There is none righteous､ not even one,
content_old: 10 Even as it is written— There is none righteous､ not even one,

content: 11 There is none that discerneth､ There is none that seeketh out God:
content_old: 11 There is none that discerneth､ There is none that seeketh out God:

content: 12 All have turned aside､ Together have become useless, There is none that doeth kindness､ Not so much as one:
content_old: 12 All have turned aside､ Together have become useless, There is none that doeth kindness､ Not so much as one:

content: 13 A sepulchre､ opened is their throat, With their tongues have they used deceit, The poison of asps is under their lips,
content_old: 13 A sepulchre､ opened is their throat, With their tongues have they used deceit, The poison of asps is under their lips,

content: 14 Whose mouth of cursing and bitterness is full,
content_old: 14 Whose mouth of cursing and bitterness is full,

content: 15 Swift are their feet to shed blood;
content_old: 15 Swift are their feet to shed blood;

content: 16 Destruction and misery are in their ways､
content_old: 16 Destruction and misery are in their ways､

content: 17 And way of peace have they not known:
content_old: 17 And way of peace have they not known:

content: 18 There is no fear of God before their eyes.
content_old: 18 There is no fear of God before their eyes.

content: 19 Now we know､ That whatsoever things the law saith To them who are within the law it speaketh, In order that every mouth may be stopped､ And all the world come under penal sentence unto God.
content_old: 19 Now we know､ That whatsoever things the law saith To them who are within the law it speaketh, In order that every mouth may be stopped､ And all the world come under penal sentence unto God.

content: 20 Inasmuch as by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous before him,— Through law in fact､ is discovery of sin.
content_old: 20 Inasmuch as by works of law shall no flesh be declared righteous before him,— Through law in fact､ is discovery of sin.

content: 21 But now apart from law a righteousness of God hath been manifested, Borne witness to by the law and the prophets,—
content_old: 21 But now apart from law a righteousness of God hath been manifested, Borne witness to by the law and the prophets,—

content: 22 A righteousness of God､ through faith in Jesus Christ､ unto all that have faith; For there is no distinction,—
content_old: 22 A righteousness of God､ through faith in Jesus Christ､ unto all that have faith; For there is no distinction,—

content: 23 For all have sinned､ and fall short of the glory of God;
content_old: 23 For all have sinned､ and fall short of the glory of God;

content: 24 Being declared righteous freely by his favour､ through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:—
content_old: 24 Being declared righteous freely by his favour､ through the redemption that is in Christ Jesus:—

content: 25 Whom God hath set forth as a propitiatory covering､ through faith in his blood, For a showing forth of his righteousness､ By reason of the passing-by of the previously committed sins､
content_old: 25 Whom God hath set forth as a propitiatory covering､ through faith in his blood, For a showing forth of his righteousness､ By reason of the passing-by of the previously committed sins､

content: 26 in the forbearance of God,— With a view to a showing forth of his righteousness in the present season, That he might be righteous even when declaring righteous him that hath faith in Jesus.
content_old: 26 in the forbearance of God,— With a view to a showing forth of his righteousness in the present season, That he might be righteous even when declaring righteous him that hath faith in Jesus.

content: 27 Where､ then､ the boasting! It is excluded. Through what kind of law? Of works? Nay! but through a law of faith:
content_old: 27 Where､ then､ the boasting! It is excluded. Through what kind of law? Of works? Nay! but through a law of faith:

content: 28 For we reckon that a man is to be declared righteous by faith apart from works of law.
content_old: 28 For we reckon that a man is to be declared righteous by faith apart from works of law.

content: 29 Or is God the God of Jews only､ and not of the nations also? Yea! of the nations also:—
content_old: 29 Or is God the God of Jews only､ and not of the nations also? Yea! of the nations also:—

content: 30 If､ at all events､ God is one, Who will declare righteous— The circumcision､ by faith, And the uncircumcision､ through their faith.
content_old: 30 If､ at all events､ God is one, Who will declare righteous— The circumcision､ by faith, And the uncircumcision､ through their faith.

content: 1 What､ then､ shall we say—as touching Abraham our forefather?
content_old: 1 What､ then､ shall we say—as touching Abraham our forefather?

content: 2 For if Abraham by works was declared righteous he hath whereof to boast;— Nevertheless､ not towards God,—
content_old: 2 For if Abraham by works was declared righteous he hath whereof to boast;— Nevertheless､ not towards God,—

content: 3 For what doth the Scripture say? And Abraham believed in God, And it was reckoned unto him as righteousness.
content_old: 3 For what doth the Scripture say? And Abraham believed in God, And it was reckoned unto him as righteousness.

content: 4 Now unto him that worketh the reward is not reckoned by way of favour､ but by way of obligation,
content_old: 4 Now unto him that worketh the reward is not reckoned by way of favour､ but by way of obligation,

content: 5 Whereas unto him that worketh not､ but believeth on him that declareth righteous the ungodly his faith is reckoned as righteousness.
content_old: 5 Whereas unto him that worketh not､ but believeth on him that declareth righteous the ungodly his faith is reckoned as righteousness.

content: 6 Just as David also affirmeth the happiness of the man､ unto whom God reckoneth righteousness､ apart from works:—
content_old: 6 Just as David also affirmeth the happiness of the man､ unto whom God reckoneth righteousness､ apart from works:—

content: 7 Happy they whose lawlessnesses have been forgiven､ And whose sins have been covered,
content_old: 7 Happy they whose lawlessnesses have been forgiven､ And whose sins have been covered,

content: 8 Happy the man whose sin the Lord will in nowise reckon.
content_old: 8 Happy the man whose sin the Lord will in nowise reckon.

content: 9 This happiness then､ is it for the circumcision､ or for the uncircumcision? For we say— His faith was reckoned unto Abraham as righteousness:
content_old: 9 This happiness then､ is it for the circumcision､ or for the uncircumcision? For we say— His faith was reckoned unto Abraham as righteousness:

content: 10 How､ then､ was it reckoned? When he was in circumcision､ or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision､ but in uncircumcision;
content_old: 10 How､ then､ was it reckoned? When he was in circumcision､ or in uncircumcision? Not in circumcision､ but in uncircumcision;

content: 11 And a sign he received namely of circumcision, A seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while yet uncircumcised; To the end he might be father of all that believe during uncircumcision, To the end the same righteousness might be reckoned unto them,—
content_old: 11 And a sign he received namely of circumcision, A seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while yet uncircumcised; To the end he might be father of all that believe during uncircumcision, To the end the same righteousness might be reckoned unto them,—

content: 12 And father of circumcision— Unto them who are not of circumcision only､ But who also walk in the steps of the faith while yet uncircumcised of our father Abraham.
content_old: 12 And father of circumcision— Unto them who are not of circumcision only､ But who also walk in the steps of the faith while yet uncircumcised of our father Abraham.

content: 13 For not through means of law doth the promise belong unto Abraham or unto his seed,— That he should be heir of the world; But through a righteousness by faith.
content_old: 13 For not through means of law doth the promise belong unto Abraham or unto his seed,— That he should be heir of the world; But through a righteousness by faith.

content: 14 For if they who are of law are heirs Made void is faith､ And of no effect is the promise.
content_old: 14 For if they who are of law are heirs Made void is faith､ And of no effect is the promise.

content: 15 For the law worketh out anger, But where there is no law neither is there transgression.
content_old: 15 For the law worketh out anger, But where there is no law neither is there transgression.

content: 16 For this cause it is by faith､ in order that it may be by way of favour, So that the promise is firm unto all the seed,— Not unto that by the law only､ But unto that also which is such by the faith of Abraham; Who is father of us all,—
content_old: 16 For this cause it is by faith､ in order that it may be by way of favour, So that the promise is firm unto all the seed,— Not unto that by the law only､ But unto that also which is such by the faith of Abraham; Who is father of us all,—

content: 17 Even as it is written— Father of many nations have I appointed thee: Before him whom he believed—God､ Who causeth the dead to live､ And calleth the things that are not as things that are:—
content_old: 17 Even as it is written— Father of many nations have I appointed thee: Before him whom he believed—God､ Who causeth the dead to live､ And calleth the things that are not as things that are:—

content: 18 Who past hope upon hope believed, So that he became father of many nations,— According to what had been said—So shall be thy seed;—
content_old: 18 Who past hope upon hope believed, So that he became father of many nations,— According to what had been said—So shall be thy seed;—

content: 19 And without becoming weak in his faith he attentively considered his own body､ already deadened—He being a hundred years old, The deadening also of Sarah’s womb;
content_old: 19 And without becoming weak in his faith he attentively considered his own body､ already deadened—He being a hundred years old, The deadening also of Sarah’s womb;

content: 20 In respect､ however､ of the promise of God he was not led to hesitate by unbelief, But received power by his faith､ Giving glory unto God,
content_old: 20 In respect､ however､ of the promise of God he was not led to hesitate by unbelief, But received power by his faith､ Giving glory unto God,

content: 21 And being fully persuaded (that)— What he hath promised Able is he also to perform:
content_old: 21 And being fully persuaded (that)— What he hath promised Able is he also to perform:

content: 22 Wherefore also､ it was reckoned unto him as righteousness.
content_old: 22 Wherefore also､ it was reckoned unto him as righteousness.

content: 23 Now it was not written for his sake alone､ that it was reckoned unto him,
content_old: 23 Now it was not written for his sake alone､ that it was reckoned unto him,

content: 24 But for our sakes also—unto whom it is to be reckoned,— Even unto them that believe upon him who raised Jesus our Lord from among the dead:
content_old: 24 But for our sakes also—unto whom it is to be reckoned,— Even unto them that believe upon him who raised Jesus our Lord from among the dead:

content: 1 Having､ therefore､ been declared righteous by faith Let us have peace towards God､ Through our Lord Jesus Christ,—
content_old: 1 Having､ therefore､ been declared righteous by faith Let us have peace towards God､ Through our Lord Jesus Christ,—

content: 2 Through whom also we have had our introduction by our faith into this favour wherein we stand; And let us boast in hope of the glory of God.
content_old: 2 Through whom also we have had our introduction by our faith into this favour wherein we stand; And let us boast in hope of the glory of God.

content: 3 And not only so But let us boast also in our tribulations; Knowing that our tribulation worketh out endurance.
content_old: 3 And not only so But let us boast also in our tribulations; Knowing that our tribulation worketh out endurance.

content: 4 And our endurance a testing, And our testing hope,
content_old: 4 And our endurance a testing, And our testing hope,

content: 5 And our hope putteth not to shame. Because the love of God hath been poured out in our hearts, Through the Holy Spirit that hath been given unto us:
content_old: 5 And our hope putteth not to shame. Because the love of God hath been poured out in our hearts, Through the Holy Spirit that hath been given unto us:

content: 6 Seeing that Christ We being weak as yet Seasonably､ in behalf of such as were ungodly died.
content_old: 6 Seeing that Christ We being weak as yet Seasonably､ in behalf of such as were ungodly died.

content: 7 For scarcely in behalf of a righteous man will one die,— In behalf of the good man､ indeed per-adventure one even dareth to die;
content_old: 7 For scarcely in behalf of a righteous man will one die,— In behalf of the good man､ indeed per-adventure one even dareth to die;

content: 8 But God commendeth his own love unto us In that— We as yet being sinners Christ in our behalf died.
content_old: 8 But God commendeth his own love unto us In that— We as yet being sinners Christ in our behalf died.

content: 9 Much more then､ having now been declared righteous by his blood Shall we be saved through him from the anger.
content_old: 9 Much more then､ having now been declared righteous by his blood Shall we be saved through him from the anger.

content: 10 For if being enemies We were reconciled unto God through the death of his Son Much more having been reconciled Shall we be saved by his life.
content_old: 10 For if being enemies We were reconciled unto God through the death of his Son Much more having been reconciled Shall we be saved by his life.

content: 11 And not only so, But are even boasting in God､ Through our Lord Jesus Christ,— Through whom now the reconciliation we have received.
content_old: 11 And not only so, But are even boasting in God､ Through our Lord Jesus Christ,— Through whom now the reconciliation we have received.

content: 12 For this cause— Just as through one man sin into the world entered, And through sin death,— And so unto all men death passed through, For that all had sinned;—
content_old: 12 For this cause— Just as through one man sin into the world entered, And through sin death,— And so unto all men death passed through, For that all had sinned;—

content: 13 For until law sin was in the world, Although sin is not reckoned､ when there is no law,—
content_old: 13 For until law sin was in the world, Although sin is not reckoned､ when there is no law,—

content: 14 Yet still death reigned from Adam until Moses, Even over them who had not sinned after the likeness of the transgression of Adam,— Who is a type of the Coming One;—
content_old: 14 Yet still death reigned from Adam until Moses, Even over them who had not sinned after the likeness of the transgression of Adam,— Who is a type of the Coming One;—

content: 15 But not as the fault So also the decree of favour, For if by the fault of the one the many died Much more the favour of God､ and the free-gift in favour､ by the one man Jesus Christ unto the many superabounded;
content_old: 15 But not as the fault So also the decree of favour, For if by the fault of the one the many died Much more the favour of God､ and the free-gift in favour､ by the one man Jesus Christ unto the many superabounded;

content: 16 And not as through one that sinned Is that which is freely given,— For the sentence of judgment indeed､ was— Out of one fault into condemnation, Whereas the decree of favour is—Out of many faults into a recovery of righteousness.
content_old: 16 And not as through one that sinned Is that which is freely given,— For the sentence of judgment indeed､ was— Out of one fault into condemnation, Whereas the decree of favour is—Out of many faults into a recovery of righteousness.

content: 17 For if by the fault of the one death reigned through the one Much more they who the superabundance of the favour and of the free-gift of the righteousness do receive In life shall reign through the one, Jesus Christ.
content_old: 17 For if by the fault of the one death reigned through the one Much more they who the superabundance of the favour and of the free-gift of the righteousness do receive In life shall reign through the one, Jesus Christ.

content: 18 Hence､ then as through one fault the sentence was unto all men unto condemnation So also､ through one recovery of righteousness the decree of favour is unto all men for righteous acquittal unto life;
content_old: 18 Hence､ then as through one fault the sentence was unto all men unto condemnation So also､ through one recovery of righteousness the decree of favour is unto all men for righteous acquittal unto life;

content: 19 For just as through the disobedience of the one man sinners the many were constituted So also through the obedience of the one righteous the many shall be constituted:—
content_old: 19 For just as through the disobedience of the one man sinners the many were constituted So also through the obedience of the one righteous the many shall be constituted:—

content: 20 Law however､ gained admission､ in order that the fault might abound, But where the sin abounded the favour greatly superabounded:—
content_old: 20 Law however､ gained admission､ in order that the fault might abound, But where the sin abounded the favour greatly superabounded:—

content: 1 What､ then､ shall we say? Are we still to continue in sin､ that favour may abound?
content_old: 1 What､ then､ shall we say? Are we still to continue in sin､ that favour may abound?

content: 2 Far be it! We who have died unto sin how any longer shall we live therein?
content_old: 2 Far be it! We who have died unto sin how any longer shall we live therein?

content: 3 Or know ye not､ that we､ as many as were immersed into Christ Jesus into his death were immersed?
content_old: 3 Or know ye not､ that we､ as many as were immersed into Christ Jesus into his death were immersed?

content: 4 We were､ therefore､ buried together with him､ through our immersion into his death, In order that— Just as Christ was raised from among the dead through the glory of the Father So we also in newness of life should walk.
content_old: 4 We were､ therefore､ buried together with him､ through our immersion into his death, In order that— Just as Christ was raised from among the dead through the glory of the Father So we also in newness of life should walk.

content: 5 For if we have come to be grown together in the likeness of his death Certainly in that of his resurrection also shall we be.
content_old: 5 For if we have come to be grown together in the likeness of his death Certainly in that of his resurrection also shall we be.

content: 6 Of this taking note— That our old man was crucified together with him､ In order that the sinful body might be made powerless, That we should no longer be in servitude to sin;
content_old: 6 Of this taking note— That our old man was crucified together with him､ In order that the sinful body might be made powerless, That we should no longer be in servitude to sin;

content: 7 For he that hath died hath become righteously acquitted from his sin.
content_old: 7 For he that hath died hath become righteously acquitted from his sin.

content: 8 Now if we have died together with Christ we believe that we shall also live together with him;
content_old: 8 Now if we have died together with Christ we believe that we shall also live together with him;

content: 9 Knowing that Christ having been raised from among the dead no more dieth,— Death over him no more hath lordship,—
content_old: 9 Knowing that Christ having been raised from among the dead no more dieth,— Death over him no more hath lordship,—

content: 10 For in that he died unto sin died he once for all, But in that he liveth he liveth unto God.
content_old: 10 For in that he died unto sin died he once for all, But in that he liveth he liveth unto God.

content: 11 So ye also be reckoning yourselves to be— Dead indeed unto sin､ But alive unto God､ in Christ Jesus.
content_old: 11 So ye also be reckoning yourselves to be— Dead indeed unto sin､ But alive unto God､ in Christ Jesus.

content: 12 Let not sin､ therefore､ reign in your death-doomed body､ That ye should be obedient to its covetings;
content_old: 12 Let not sin､ therefore､ reign in your death-doomed body､ That ye should be obedient to its covetings;

content: 13 Neither be presenting your members､ as weapons of unrighteousness､ unto sin, But present yourselves unto God､ as though alive from among the dead, And your members､ as weapons of righteousness unto God;
content_old: 13 Neither be presenting your members､ as weapons of unrighteousness､ unto sin, But present yourselves unto God､ as though alive from among the dead, And your members､ as weapons of righteousness unto God;

content: 14 For sin over you shall not have lordship､ For ye are not under law､ but under favour.
content_old: 14 For sin over you shall not have lordship､ For ye are not under law､ but under favour.

content: 15 What then? Shall we sin, because we are not under law､ but under favour? Far be it!
content_old: 15 What then? Shall we sin, because we are not under law､ but under favour? Far be it!

content: 16 Know ye not that unto whom ye are presenting yourselves as servants for obedience Servants ye are unto him unto whom ye are obedient, Whether of sin unto death､ Or of obedience unto righteousness?
content_old: 16 Know ye not that unto whom ye are presenting yourselves as servants for obedience Servants ye are unto him unto whom ye are obedient, Whether of sin unto death､ Or of obedience unto righteousness?

content: 17 But thanks be unto God､ that— Whereas ye were servants of sin Ye became obedient out of the heart unto the mould of teaching into which ye were delivered;
content_old: 17 But thanks be unto God､ that— Whereas ye were servants of sin Ye became obedient out of the heart unto the mould of teaching into which ye were delivered;

content: 18 And being freed from sin ye were made servants unto righteousness;—
content_old: 18 And being freed from sin ye were made servants unto righteousness;—

content: 19 In human fashion am I speaking, because of the weakness of your flesh;— For just as ye presented your members as servants unto impurity and unto lawlessness for lawlessness. So､ now present ye your members as servants unto righteousness､ for sanctiflcation.
content_old: 19 In human fashion am I speaking, because of the weakness of your flesh;— For just as ye presented your members as servants unto impurity and unto lawlessness for lawlessness. So､ now present ye your members as servants unto righteousness､ for sanctiflcation.

content: 20 For when ye were servants of sin ye were free as to righteousness;—
content_old: 20 For when ye were servants of sin ye were free as to righteousness;—

content: 21 What fruit､ therefore､ had ye then—in things for which ye now are taking shame to yourselves? For the end of those things is death.
content_old: 21 What fruit､ therefore､ had ye then—in things for which ye now are taking shame to yourselves? For the end of those things is death.

content: 22 Whereas now having been freed from sin､ and made servants unto God Ye have your fruit for sanctification､ And the end life age-abiding.
content_old: 22 Whereas now having been freed from sin､ and made servants unto God Ye have your fruit for sanctification､ And the end life age-abiding.

content: 1 Or are ye ignorant､ brethren,— For unto them that understand law am I speaking That the law hath lordship over a man as long as he liveth?
content_old: 1 Or are ye ignorant､ brethren,— For unto them that understand law am I speaking That the law hath lordship over a man as long as he liveth?

content: 2 For the married woman unto her living husband is bound by law; But if her husband have died She hath received a full release from the law of her husband.
content_old: 2 For the married woman unto her living husband is bound by law; But if her husband have died She hath received a full release from the law of her husband.

content: 3 Hence then her husband being alive An adulteress shall she be called—If she become another man’s, But if the husband have died she is free from the law; So that she is not an adulteress､ though she become another man’s.
content_old: 3 Hence then her husband being alive An adulteress shall she be called—If she become another man’s, But if the husband have died she is free from the law; So that she is not an adulteress､ though she become another man’s.

content: 4 So､ then､ my brethren ye also were made dead unto the law through the body of the Christ, To the end ye might become another’s— His who from among the dead was raised, In order that we might bring forth fruit unto God.
content_old: 4 So､ then､ my brethren ye also were made dead unto the law through the body of the Christ, To the end ye might become another’s— His who from among the dead was raised, In order that we might bring forth fruit unto God.

content: 5 For when we were in the flesh the susceptibilities of sins which were through the law used to be energized in our members､ unto the bringing forth of fruit unto death;
content_old: 5 For when we were in the flesh the susceptibilities of sins which were through the law used to be energized in our members､ unto the bringing forth of fruit unto death;

content: 6 But now we have received full release from the law､ by dying in that wherein we used to be held fast, So that we should be doing service— In newness of spirit､ And not in obsoleteness of letter.
content_old: 6 But now we have received full release from the law､ by dying in that wherein we used to be held fast, So that we should be doing service— In newness of spirit､ And not in obsoleteness of letter.

content: 7 What､ then､ shall we say? Is the law sin? Far be it! On the contrary I had not discovered sin save through law, For even of coveting I had not been aware､ if the law had not kept on saying— Thou shalt not covet;
content_old: 7 What､ then､ shall we say? Is the law sin? Far be it! On the contrary I had not discovered sin save through law, For even of coveting I had not been aware､ if the law had not kept on saying— Thou shalt not covet;

content: 8 Howbeit sin､ taking occasion— Through the commandment wrought out in me all manner of coveting; For apart from law sin is dead;—
content_old: 8 Howbeit sin､ taking occasion— Through the commandment wrought out in me all manner of coveting; For apart from law sin is dead;—

content: 9 And I was alive､ apart from law､ at one time, But the commandment coming Sin sprang up to life､
content_old: 9 And I was alive､ apart from law､ at one time, But the commandment coming Sin sprang up to life､

content: 10 whereas I died,— And the commandment which was unto life was found by me to be itself unto death;
content_old: 10 whereas I died,— And the commandment which was unto life was found by me to be itself unto death;

content: 11 For sin—taking occasion— Through the commandment completely deceived me､ And through it slew me:
content_old: 11 For sin—taking occasion— Through the commandment completely deceived me､ And through it slew me:

content: 12 So that the law indeed､ is holy, and the commandment holy､ and righteous and good.
content_old: 12 So that the law indeed､ is holy, and the commandment holy､ and righteous and good.

content: 13 Did､ then､ that which is good unto me become death? Far be it! But it was sin that it might appear sin through that which was good unto me working out death, In order that exceeding sinful might sin become through the commandment.
content_old: 13 Did､ then､ that which is good unto me become death? Far be it! But it was sin that it might appear sin through that which was good unto me working out death, In order that exceeding sinful might sin become through the commandment.

content: 14 For we know､ that the law is spiritual,— I however､ am a creature of flesh, Sold under sin;
content_old: 14 For we know､ that the law is spiritual,— I however､ am a creature of flesh, Sold under sin;

content: 15 For that which I am working out I do not approve,— For not what I wish the same I practise, But what I hate the same I do:
content_old: 15 For that which I am working out I do not approve,— For not what I wish the same I practise, But what I hate the same I do:

content: 16 Now if what I wish not the same I do I consent unto the law､ that it is right.
content_old: 16 Now if what I wish not the same I do I consent unto the law､ that it is right.

content: 17 Now however､ no longer am I working it out､ But the sin that dwelleth in me:
content_old: 17 Now however､ no longer am I working it out､ But the sin that dwelleth in me:

content: 18 I know､ in fact､ that there dwelleth not in me that is､ in my flesh anything good; For the wishing lieth near me, But the working out of what is right not!
content_old: 18 I know､ in fact､ that there dwelleth not in me that is､ in my flesh anything good; For the wishing lieth near me, But the working out of what is right not!

content: 19 For not the good that I wish I do, But the evil that I do not wish the same I practise.
content_old: 19 For not the good that I wish I do, But the evil that I do not wish the same I practise.

content: 20 Now if what I wish not the same I do No longer am I working it out, But the sin that dwelleth in me.
content_old: 20 Now if what I wish not the same I do No longer am I working it out, But the sin that dwelleth in me.

content: 21 Hence､ I find the law To me who wish to be doing the right That unto me the wrong lieth near:
content_old: 21 Hence､ I find the law To me who wish to be doing the right That unto me the wrong lieth near:

content: 22 I have､ in fact､ a sympathetic pleasure in the law of God; according to the inner man.
content_old: 22 I have､ in fact､ a sympathetic pleasure in the law of God; according to the inner man.

content: 23 But I behold a diverse law in my members, Warring against the law of my mind､ And taking me captive in the law of sin which existeth in my members:—
content_old: 23 But I behold a diverse law in my members, Warring against the law of my mind､ And taking me captive in the law of sin which existeth in my members:—

content: 24 Wretched man am I! Who shall rescue me out of this body doomed to death?
content_old: 24 Wretched man am I! Who shall rescue me out of this body doomed to death?

content: 1 Hence､ there is now no condemnation､ unto them who are in Christ Jesus;
content_old: 1 Hence､ there is now no condemnation､ unto them who are in Christ Jesus;

content: 2 For the law of the spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath set thee free from the law of sin and of death;—
content_old: 2 For the law of the spirit of life in Christ Jesus hath set thee free from the law of sin and of death;—

content: 3 For What was impossible by the law､ in that it was weak through the flesh God by sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh､ and concerning sin Condemned sin in the flesh,
content_old: 3 For What was impossible by the law､ in that it was weak through the flesh God by sending his own Son in the likeness of sinful flesh､ and concerning sin Condemned sin in the flesh,

content: 4 In order that the righteous requirement of the law might be fulfilled in us— Who not according to flesh do walk､ But according to spirit;
content_old: 4 In order that the righteous requirement of the law might be fulfilled in us— Who not according to flesh do walk､ But according to spirit;

content: 5 For they who according to flesh have their being The things of the flesh do prefer, But they according to the spirit The things of the spirit;
content_old: 5 For they who according to flesh have their being The things of the flesh do prefer, But they according to the spirit The things of the spirit;

content: 6 For what is preferred by the flesh is death, Whereas what is preferred by the spirit is life and peace;—
content_old: 6 For what is preferred by the flesh is death, Whereas what is preferred by the spirit is life and peace;—

content: 7 Inasmuch as what is preferred by the flesh is hostile towards God, For unto the law of God it doth not submit itself､ neither in fact can it,—
content_old: 7 Inasmuch as what is preferred by the flesh is hostile towards God, For unto the law of God it doth not submit itself､ neither in fact can it,—

content: 8 They��� moreover､ who in flesh have their being cannot please God.
content_old: 8 They��� moreover､ who in flesh have their being cannot please God.

content: 9 But ye have not your being in flesh､ but in spirit,— If at least God’s Spirit dwelleth in you; And if anyone hath not Christ’s Spirit The same is not his;—
content_old: 9 But ye have not your being in flesh､ but in spirit,— If at least God’s Spirit dwelleth in you; And if anyone hath not Christ’s Spirit The same is not his;—

content: 10 But if Christ is in you The body indeed､ is dead by reason of sin, Whereas the spirit is life by reason of righteousness;
content_old: 10 But if Christ is in you The body indeed､ is dead by reason of sin, Whereas the spirit is life by reason of righteousness;

content: 11 If､ moreover the Spirit of him that raised Jesus from among the dead dwelleth in you He that raised､ from among the dead､ Christ Jesus Shall make alive even your death-doomed bodies､ Through means of his indwelling Spirit within you.
content_old: 11 If､ moreover the Spirit of him that raised Jesus from among the dead dwelleth in you He that raised､ from among the dead､ Christ Jesus Shall make alive even your death-doomed bodies､ Through means of his indwelling Spirit within you.

content: 12 Hence､ then､ brethren—debtors we are､ Not unto the flesh, that according to flesh we should live,—
content_old: 12 Hence､ then､ brethren—debtors we are､ Not unto the flesh, that according to flesh we should live,—

content: 13 For if according to flesh ye live ye are about to die, Whereas if in spirit the practices of the flesh ye are putting to death ye shall attain unto life;
content_old: 13 For if according to flesh ye live ye are about to die, Whereas if in spirit the practices of the flesh ye are putting to death ye shall attain unto life;

content: 14 For as many as by God’s Spirit are being led the same are God’s sons,—
content_old: 14 For as many as by God’s Spirit are being led the same are God’s sons,—

content: 15 For ye have not received a spirit of servitude､ leading back into fear, But ye have received a spirit of sonship､ Whereby we are exclaiming— Abba! Oh Father!
content_old: 15 For ye have not received a spirit of servitude､ leading back into fear, But ye have received a spirit of sonship､ Whereby we are exclaiming— Abba! Oh Father!

content: 16 The Spirit itself beareth witness together with our spirit､ that we are children of God;
content_old: 16 The Spirit itself beareth witness together with our spirit､ that we are children of God;

content: 17 And if children heirs also— Heirs､ indeed､ of God, But co-heirs with Christ,— If､ at least､ we are suffering together, In order that we may also be glorified together.
content_old: 17 And if children heirs also— Heirs､ indeed､ of God, But co-heirs with Christ,— If､ at least､ we are suffering together, In order that we may also be glorified together.

content: 18 For I reckon､ that unworthy are the sufferings of the present season､ To be compared with the glory about to be revealed towards us;
content_old: 18 For I reckon､ that unworthy are the sufferings of the present season､ To be compared with the glory about to be revealed towards us;

content: 19 For the eager outlook of creation ardently awaiteth the revealing of the sons of God,—
content_old: 19 For the eager outlook of creation ardently awaiteth the revealing of the sons of God,—

content: 20 For unto vanity hath creation been made subject— Not by choice, But by reason of him that made it subject In hope
content_old: 20 For unto vanity hath creation been made subject— Not by choice, But by reason of him that made it subject In hope

content: 21 that creation itself also shall be freed— From the bondage of the decay､ Into the freedom of the glory､ of the sons of God;
content_old: 21 that creation itself also shall be freed— From the bondage of the decay､ Into the freedom of the glory､ of the sons of God;

content: 22 For we know､ that all creation is sighing together､ and travailing-in-birth-throes together､ until the present,—
content_old: 22 For we know､ that all creation is sighing together､ and travailing-in-birth-throes together､ until the present,—

content: 23 And not only so But we ourselves also､ who have the first-fruit of the Spirit— We even ourselves within our own selves do sigh,— Sonship ardently awaiting—The redeeming of our body;—
content_old: 23 And not only so But we ourselves also､ who have the first-fruit of the Spirit— We even ourselves within our own selves do sigh,— Sonship ardently awaiting—The redeeming of our body;—

content: 24 For by our hope have we been saved,— But hope beheld is not hope, For what one beholdeth why doth he hope for?
content_old: 24 For by our hope have we been saved,— But hope beheld is not hope, For what one beholdeth why doth he hope for?

content: 25 If､ however､ what we do not behold we hope for With endurance are we ardently awaiting it;—
content_old: 25 If､ however､ what we do not behold we hope for With endurance are we ardently awaiting it;—

content: 26 In the selfsame way moreover､ even the Spirit helpeth together in our weakness,— For what we should pray for as we ought we know not, But the Spirit itself maketh intercession､ with sighings unutterable,
content_old: 26 In the selfsame way moreover､ even the Spirit helpeth together in our weakness,— For what we should pray for as we ought we know not, But the Spirit itself maketh intercession､ with sighings unutterable,

content: 27 And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is preferred by the Spirit— That according to God he maketh intercession in behalf of saints;
content_old: 27 And he that searcheth the hearts knoweth what is preferred by the Spirit— That according to God he maketh intercession in behalf of saints;

content: 28 We know､ further､ that unto them who love God God causeth all things to work together､ for good,— Unto them who according to purpose are such as he hath called;
content_old: 28 We know､ further､ that unto them who love God God causeth all things to work together､ for good,— Unto them who according to purpose are such as he hath called;

content: 29 For whom he fore-approved He also fore-appointed､ to be conformed unto the image of his Son, That he might be firstborn among many brethren,—
content_old: 29 For whom he fore-approved He also fore-appointed､ to be conformed unto the image of his Son, That he might be firstborn among many brethren,—

content: 30 And whom he fore-appointed The same he also called, And whom he called The same he also declared righteous, And whom he declared righteous The same he also made glorious:—
content_old: 30 And whom he fore-appointed The same he also called, And whom he called The same he also declared righteous, And whom he declared righteous The same he also made glorious:—

content: 31 What､ then､ shall we say to these things? If God is for us who shall be against us?
content_old: 31 What､ then､ shall we say to these things? If God is for us who shall be against us?

content: 32 He､ at least､ who his own Son did not spare､ But in behalf of us all delivered him up How shall he not also with him all things upon us in favour bestow?
content_old: 32 He､ at least､ who his own Son did not spare､ But in behalf of us all delivered him up How shall he not also with him all things upon us in favour bestow?

content: 33 Who shall bring an accusation against the chosen ones of God? God､ who declareth righteous?
content_old: 33 Who shall bring an accusation against the chosen ones of God? God､ who declareth righteous?

content: 34 Who is he that condemneth? Christ Jesus who died?— Nay! rather was raised from among the dead,— Who is on the right hand of God, Who also is making intercession in our behalf?
content_old: 34 Who is he that condemneth? Christ Jesus who died?— Nay! rather was raised from among the dead,— Who is on the right hand of God, Who also is making intercession in our behalf?

content: 35 Who shall separate us from the love of the Christ? Shall tribulation､ or distress､ or persecution､ or famine､ or nakedness､ or peril､ or sword?—
content_old: 35 Who shall separate us from the love of the Christ? Shall tribulation､ or distress､ or persecution､ or famine､ or nakedness､ or peril､ or sword?—

content: 36 According as it is written— For thy sake are we being put to death all the day long, We have been reckoned as sheep for slaughter.—
content_old: 36 According as it is written— For thy sake are we being put to death all the day long, We have been reckoned as sheep for slaughter.—

content: 37 Nay in all these things we are more than conquering､ Through him that hath loved us.
content_old: 37 Nay in all these things we are more than conquering､ Through him that hath loved us.

content: 38 For I am persuaded that— Neither death nor life､ nor messengers nor principalities､ nor things present nor things to come､ nor powers,
content_old: 38 For I am persuaded that— Neither death nor life､ nor messengers nor principalities､ nor things present nor things to come､ nor powers,

content: 1 Truth say I､ in Christ, I utter no falsehood,— My conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Spirit—
content_old: 1 Truth say I､ in Christ, I utter no falsehood,— My conscience bearing witness with me in the Holy Spirit—

content: 2 That I have great grief and incessant travail in my heart;
content_old: 2 That I have great grief and incessant travail in my heart;

content: 3 For I could have wished to be accursed even I myself from the Christ､ In behalf of my brethren my kinsmen according to the flesh;—
content_old: 3 For I could have wished to be accursed even I myself from the Christ､ In behalf of my brethren my kinsmen according to the flesh;—

content: 4 Who indeed､ are Israelites, Whose are the sonship､ and the glory､ and the covenants､ and the legislation､ and the divine service､ and the promises,
content_old: 4 Who indeed､ are Israelites, Whose are the sonship､ and the glory､ and the covenants､ and the legislation､ and the divine service､ and the promises,

content: 5 Whose are the fathers, And of whom is the Christ—according to the flesh,— He who is over all､ God､ blessed unto the ages. Amen.
content_old: 5 Whose are the fathers, And of whom is the Christ—according to the flesh,— He who is over all､ God､ blessed unto the ages. Amen.

content: 6 It is not､ however､ as though the word of God had failed; For not all they who are of Israel the same are Israel,
content_old: 6 It is not､ however､ as though the word of God had failed; For not all they who are of Israel the same are Israel,

content: 7 Neither because they are seed of Abraham are all children,— But In Isaac shall there be called unto thee a seed.
content_old: 7 Neither because they are seed of Abraham are all children,— But In Isaac shall there be called unto thee a seed.

content: 8 That is—Not the children of the flesh the same are children of God; But the children of the promise are reckoned as a seed.
content_old: 8 That is—Not the children of the flesh the same are children of God; But the children of the promise are reckoned as a seed.

content: 9 For of promise is this word— According to this season will I come, And Sarah shall have a son.
content_old: 9 For of promise is this word— According to this season will I come, And Sarah shall have a son.

content: 10 And not only so But when Rebekah also was with child of one— Isaac our father,—
content_old: 10 And not only so But when Rebekah also was with child of one— Isaac our father,—

content: 11 They､ in fact､ not being yet born､ nor having practised anything good or bad,— In order that the purpose of God by way of election might stand,— Not by works､ But by him that was calling
content_old: 11 They､ in fact､ not being yet born､ nor having practised anything good or bad,— In order that the purpose of God by way of election might stand,— Not by works､ But by him that was calling

content: 12 It was said unto her— The elder shall serve the younger;
content_old: 12 It was said unto her— The elder shall serve the younger;

content: 13 Even as it is written— Jacob have I loved､ but Esau have I hated.
content_old: 13 Even as it is written— Jacob have I loved､ but Esau have I hated.

content: 14 What､ then､ shall we say? Is there injustice with God? Far be it!
content_old: 14 What､ then､ shall we say? Is there injustice with God? Far be it!

content: 15 For unto Moses he saith— I will have mercy upon whomsoever I can have mercy, And I will have compassion upon whomsoever I can have compassion.
content_old: 15 For unto Moses he saith— I will have mercy upon whomsoever I can have mercy, And I will have compassion upon whomsoever I can have compassion.

content: 16 Hence､ then､ it is not of him that wisheth､ nor of him that runneth, But of the mercy-shewing God.
content_old: 16 Hence､ then､ it is not of him that wisheth､ nor of him that runneth, But of the mercy-shewing God.

content: 17 For the Scripture saith unto Pharaoh— Unto this end have I raised thee up, That I may thus shew in thee my power､ And that I may declare my name in all the earth.
content_old: 17 For the Scripture saith unto Pharaoh— Unto this end have I raised thee up, That I may thus shew in thee my power､ And that I may declare my name in all the earth.

content: 18 Hence､ then､— On whom he pleaseth he hath mercy, And whom he pleaseth he doth harden.
content_old: 18 Hence､ then､— On whom he pleaseth he hath mercy, And whom he pleaseth he doth harden.

content: 19 Thou wilt say to me､ then— Why longer findeth he fault? For his purpose who hath withstood?
content_old: 19 Thou wilt say to me､ then— Why longer findeth he fault? For his purpose who hath withstood?

content: 20 O man! Who､ nevertheless､ art thou that art answering again unto God? Shall the thing formed say unto him that formed it— Why didst thou make me thus?
content_old: 20 O man! Who､ nevertheless､ art thou that art answering again unto God? Shall the thing formed say unto him that formed it— Why didst thou make me thus?

content: 21 Or hath not the potter a right over the clay— Out of the same lump､ To make some､ indeed､ into a vessel for honour, And some for dishonour?
content_old: 21 Or hath not the potter a right over the clay— Out of the same lump､ To make some､ indeed､ into a vessel for honour, And some for dishonour?

content: 22 And if God— Wishing to shew his anger､ and to make known his power— Bare､ in much patience､ with vessels of anger already fitted for destruction,
content_old: 22 And if God— Wishing to shew his anger､ and to make known his power— Bare､ in much patience､ with vessels of anger already fitted for destruction,

content: 23 In order that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy which he prepared beforehand for glory,—
content_old: 23 In order that he might make known the riches of his glory upon vessels of mercy which he prepared beforehand for glory,—

content: 24 Whom he also called､ even us Not only from among Jews､ But also from among the nations What then?
content_old: 24 Whom he also called､ even us Not only from among Jews､ But also from among the nations What then?

content: 25 As also in Hosea he saith— I will call the Not-my-people My people､ And the Not-beloved Beloved,
content_old: 25 As also in Hosea he saith— I will call the Not-my-people My people､ And the Not-beloved Beloved,

content: 26 And it shall be— In the place where it was said to them— Not my people are ye! There shall they be called— Sons of a Living God.
content_old: 26 And it shall be— In the place where it was said to them— Not my people are ye! There shall they be called— Sons of a Living God.

content: 27 Isaiah moreover､ exclaimeth over Israel— Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea The remnant shall be saved;
content_old: 27 Isaiah moreover､ exclaimeth over Israel— Though the number of the sons of Israel be as the sand of the sea The remnant shall be saved;

content: 28 For a complete and concise account will the Lord make upon the earth.
content_old: 28 For a complete and concise account will the Lord make upon the earth.

content: 29 And even as Isaiah hath before said— If the Lord of hosts had not left us a seed As Sodom had we become､ And as Gomorrha had we been made like.
content_old: 29 And even as Isaiah hath before said— If the Lord of hosts had not left us a seed As Sodom had we become､ And as Gomorrha had we been made like.

content: 30 What､ then､ shall we say? That they of the nations Who were not in pursuit of righteousness Have laid hold of righteousness,— A righteousness､ however､ which is by faith;
content_old: 30 What､ then､ shall we say? That they of the nations Who were not in pursuit of righteousness Have laid hold of righteousness,— A righteousness､ however､ which is by faith;

content: 31 Whereas Israel Though in pursuit of a law of righteousness Unto a law have not attained.
content_old: 31 Whereas Israel Though in pursuit of a law of righteousness Unto a law have not attained.

content: 32 Wherefore? Because not by faith､ But as by works have they sought it: They have stumbled at the stone of stumbling,
content_old: 32 Wherefore? Because not by faith､ But as by works have they sought it: They have stumbled at the stone of stumbling,

content: 1 Brethren! the delight of my own heart､ and my supplication God-ward､ in their behalf are for salvation;
content_old: 1 Brethren! the delight of my own heart､ and my supplication God-ward､ in their behalf are for salvation;

content: 2 For I bear them witness､ that they have a zeal for God,—but not according to correct knowledge;
content_old: 2 For I bear them witness､ that they have a zeal for God,—but not according to correct knowledge;

content: 3 For Not knowing God’s righteousness､ And their own seeking to establish Unto the righteousness of God have they not submitted;
content_old: 3 For Not knowing God’s righteousness､ And their own seeking to establish Unto the righteousness of God have they not submitted;

content: 4 For Christ is an end of law for righteousness､ unto every one that believeth.
content_old: 4 For Christ is an end of law for righteousness､ unto every one that believeth.

content: 5 For Moses writeth､ that— As touching the righteousness that is by law The man that hath done it shall live thereby;
content_old: 5 For Moses writeth､ that— As touching the righteousness that is by law The man that hath done it shall live thereby;

content: 6 Whereas the righteousness by faith thus speaketh— Do not say in thy heart､ Who shall ascend into heaven? That is､ To bring Christ down,
content_old: 6 Whereas the righteousness by faith thus speaketh— Do not say in thy heart､ Who shall ascend into heaven? That is､ To bring Christ down,

content: 7 Or､ Who shall descend into the abyss? That is､ To bring up Christ､ from among the dead;
content_old: 7 Or､ Who shall descend into the abyss? That is､ To bring up Christ､ from among the dead;

content: 8 But what saith it? Near thee is the declaration, In thy mouth､ and in thy heart,— That is､ The declaration of the faith､ which we proclaim:—
content_old: 8 But what saith it? Near thee is the declaration, In thy mouth､ and in thy heart,— That is､ The declaration of the faith､ which we proclaim:—

content: 9 That if thou shalt confess the declaration､ with thy mouth— That Jesus is Lord, And shalt believe､ with thy heart— That God raised him from among the dead Thou shalt be saved;—
content_old: 9 That if thou shalt confess the declaration､ with thy mouth— That Jesus is Lord, And shalt believe､ with thy heart— That God raised him from among the dead Thou shalt be saved;—

content: 10 For in heart it is to be believed unto righteousness, And by mouth it is to be confessed unto salvation.
content_old: 10 For in heart it is to be believed unto righteousness, And by mouth it is to be confessed unto salvation.

content: 11 For the scripture saith— No one that resteth faith thereupon shall be put to shame;
content_old: 11 For the scripture saith— No one that resteth faith thereupon shall be put to shame;

content: 12 For there is no distinction—of Jew or Greek,— For the same Lord is Lord of all､ Being rich unto all who call upon him;
content_old: 12 For there is no distinction—of Jew or Greek,— For the same Lord is Lord of all､ Being rich unto all who call upon him;

content: 13 For Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved:—
content_old: 13 For Whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved:—

content: 14 How､ then､ shall men call upon one in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in one of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear､ without one to proclaim?
content_old: 14 How､ then､ shall men call upon one in whom they have not believed? And how shall they believe in one of whom they have not heard? And how shall they hear､ without one to proclaim?

content: 15 And how shall they proclaim､ except they be sent? Even as it is written— How beautiful the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things!
content_old: 15 And how shall they proclaim､ except they be sent? Even as it is written— How beautiful the feet of them that bring glad tidings of good things!

content: 16 But not all have become obedient unto the glad tidings;— For Isaiah saith— Lord! who believed what we have heard?
content_old: 16 But not all have become obedient unto the glad tidings;— For Isaiah saith— Lord! who believed what we have heard?

content: 17 Hence our faith cometh by something heard, And that which is heard through a declaration of Christ.
content_old: 17 Hence our faith cometh by something heard, And that which is heard through a declaration of Christ.

content: 18 But I say: Have they not heard? Yea indeed— Into all the earth hath gone forth their sound, And unto the ends of the inhabited world their declarations.
content_old: 18 But I say: Have they not heard? Yea indeed— Into all the earth hath gone forth their sound, And unto the ends of the inhabited world their declarations.

content: 19 But I say: Hath Israel not come to know? First Moses saith— I will provoke you to jealousy on account of a no-nation, On account of an undiscerning nation will I make you very angry.
content_old: 19 But I say: Hath Israel not come to know? First Moses saith— I will provoke you to jealousy on account of a no-nation, On account of an undiscerning nation will I make you very angry.

content: 20 Isaiah however､ waxeth daring, and saith— I have been found by them who after me were not seeking, Manifest have I become､ unto them who for me were not enquiring;
content_old: 20 Isaiah however､ waxeth daring, and saith— I have been found by them who after me were not seeking, Manifest have I become､ unto them who for me were not enquiring;

content: 1 I say､ then— Hath God cast off his people? Far be it! For I also am an Israelite,— Of the seed of Abraham, Of the tribe of Benjamin:
content_old: 1 I say､ then— Hath God cast off his people? Far be it! For I also am an Israelite,— Of the seed of Abraham, Of the tribe of Benjamin:

content: 2 God hath not cast off his people､ whom he foreapproved. Or know ye not､ in the account of Elijah､ what the scripture saith､ when he intercedeth with God against Israel?
content_old: 2 God hath not cast off his people､ whom he foreapproved. Or know ye not､ in the account of Elijah､ what the scripture saith､ when he intercedeth with God against Israel?

content: 3 Lord! Thy prophets have they slain､ Thine altars have they overthrown, And I am left alone､ And they are seeking my life!
content_old: 3 Lord! Thy prophets have they slain､ Thine altars have they overthrown, And I am left alone､ And they are seeking my life!

content: 4 But what saith unto him the response? I have left for myself seven thousand men, who､ indeed､ have not bowed a knee unto Baal.
content_old: 4 But what saith unto him the response? I have left for myself seven thousand men, who､ indeed､ have not bowed a knee unto Baal.

content: 5 Thus then in the present season also A remnant､ by way of an election of favour hath come into being.
content_old: 5 Thus then in the present season also A remnant､ by way of an election of favour hath come into being.

content: 6 If､ however､ by favour no longer of works; else favour no longer proveth to be favour!
content_old: 6 If､ however､ by favour no longer of works; else favour no longer proveth to be favour!

content: 7 What then? That which Israel seeketh after the same it hath not obtained:— The election､ however､ have obtained it, and the rest have been hardened;—
content_old: 7 What then? That which Israel seeketh after the same it hath not obtained:— The election､ however､ have obtained it, and the rest have been hardened;—

content: 8 Even as it is written—God hath given unto them a spirit of stupor,—eyes､ not to see, and ears､ not to hear,—until this very day;
content_old: 8 Even as it is written—God hath given unto them a spirit of stupor,—eyes､ not to see, and ears､ not to hear,—until this very day;

content: 9 And David saith— Let their table be turned into a snare､ and into a gin､ and into a trap､ and into a recompense unto them,
content_old: 9 And David saith— Let their table be turned into a snare､ and into a gin､ and into a trap､ and into a recompense unto them,

content: 10 Darkened be their eyes､ not to see, And their back do thou continually bow down.
content_old: 10 Darkened be their eyes､ not to see, And their back do thou continually bow down.

content: 11 I say then—Did they stumble in order that they might fall? Far be it! But by their fall salvation hath come unto the nations, to the end of provoking them to jealousy.
content_old: 11 I say then—Did they stumble in order that they might fall? Far be it! But by their fall salvation hath come unto the nations, to the end of provoking them to jealousy.

content: 12 If､ moreover､ their fall is the riches of a world, And their loss､ the riches of nations How much rather their fullness?
content_old: 12 If､ moreover､ their fall is the riches of a world, And their loss､ the riches of nations How much rather their fullness?

content: 13 Unto you however､ am I speaking,—you of the nations; Inasmuch､ indeed､ then､ as I am an apostle to the nations my ministry I glorify,
content_old: 13 Unto you however､ am I speaking,—you of the nations; Inasmuch､ indeed､ then､ as I am an apostle to the nations my ministry I glorify,

content: 14 If by any means I may provoke to jealousy my own flesh, And save some from among them;—
content_old: 14 If by any means I may provoke to jealousy my own flesh, And save some from among them;—

content: 15 For if the casting away of them hath become the reconciling of a world What shall the taking of them in addition be､ but life from among the dead?
content_old: 15 For if the casting away of them hath become the reconciling of a world What shall the taking of them in addition be､ but life from among the dead?

content: 16 If､ moreover､ the first fruit is holy the lump shall be also; And if the root is holy the branches shall be also.
content_old: 16 If､ moreover､ the first fruit is holy the lump shall be also; And if the root is holy the branches shall be also.

content: 17 If､ however､ some of the branches have been broken out, And thou being a wild olive hast been grafted in among them､ And hast become a joint partaker of the root of the fatness of the olive
content_old: 17 If､ however､ some of the branches have been broken out, And thou being a wild olive hast been grafted in among them､ And hast become a joint partaker of the root of the fatness of the olive

content: 18 Be not boasting over the branches! Howbeit if thou boast It is not thou that bearest the root, But the root thee!
content_old: 18 Be not boasting over the branches! Howbeit if thou boast It is not thou that bearest the root, But the root thee!

content: 19 Thou wilt say､ then— Branches were broken out､ in order that I might be grafted in.
content_old: 19 Thou wilt say､ then— Branches were broken out､ in order that I might be grafted in.

content: 20 Well: By their want of faith they have been broken out,— And thou by thy faith dost stand!— Regard not lofty things､ But be afraid;
