content_old: 20 Well: By their want of faith they have been broken out,— And thou by thy faith dost stand!— Regard not lofty things､ But be afraid;

content: 21 For if God hath not spared the natural branches Neither thee will he spare!
content_old: 21 For if God hath not spared the natural branches Neither thee will he spare!

content: 22 See､ then､ the kindness and the severity of God: Upon them who have fallen severity,— But upon thee the kindness of God, If thou abide still in the kindness,— Otherwise thou also shalt be cut out;
content_old: 22 See､ then､ the kindness and the severity of God: Upon them who have fallen severity,— But upon thee the kindness of God, If thou abide still in the kindness,— Otherwise thou also shalt be cut out;

content: 23 Whereas they also unless they abide still in their want of faith Shall be grafted in, For God is able again to engraft them!
content_old: 23 Whereas they also unless they abide still in their want of faith Shall be grafted in, For God is able again to engraft them!

content: 24 For if thou out of the naturally wild olive was cut out, And beyond nature hast been engrafted into the good olive How much rather shall these､ the natural branches be engrafted into their own olive tree?
content_old: 24 For if thou out of the naturally wild olive was cut out, And beyond nature hast been engrafted into the good olive How much rather shall these､ the natural branches be engrafted into their own olive tree?

content: 25 For I wish not､ ye should be ignorant､ brethren､ of this sacred secret, Lest within yourselves ye be presumptuous That a hardening in part hath befallen Israel､ Until the full measure of the nations shall come in;
content_old: 25 For I wish not､ ye should be ignorant､ brethren､ of this sacred secret, Lest within yourselves ye be presumptuous That a hardening in part hath befallen Israel､ Until the full measure of the nations shall come in;

content: 26 And so all Israel shall be saved: Even as it is written— There shall have come out of Zion the Deliverer,— He will turn away ungodliness from Jacob;
content_old: 26 And so all Israel shall be saved: Even as it is written— There shall have come out of Zion the Deliverer,— He will turn away ungodliness from Jacob;

content: 27 And this､ for them is the covenant from me, As soon as I take away their sins.
content_old: 27 And this､ for them is the covenant from me, As soon as I take away their sins.

content: 28 As touching the joyful-message､ indeed they are enemies for your sake, But as touching the election beloved for their fathers’ sake;
content_old: 28 As touching the joyful-message､ indeed they are enemies for your sake, But as touching the election beloved for their fathers’ sake;

content: 29 For not to be regretted are the gifts and the calling of God:—
content_old: 29 For not to be regretted are the gifts and the calling of God:—

content: 30 For just as ye at one time had not yielded unto God, And yet now have received mercy by their refusal to yield
content_old: 30 For just as ye at one time had not yielded unto God, And yet now have received mercy by their refusal to yield

content: 31 So these also have now refused to yield､ by your own mercy, In order that themselves also should now become objects of mercy;
content_old: 31 So these also have now refused to yield､ by your own mercy, In order that themselves also should now become objects of mercy;

content: 32 For God hath shut up all together､ in a refusal to yield, In order that upon all he may bestow mercy.
content_old: 32 For God hath shut up all together､ in a refusal to yield, In order that upon all he may bestow mercy.

content: 33 Oh! the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable his judgments! And untraceable his ways!
content_old: 33 Oh! the depth of the riches and wisdom and knowledge of God! How unsearchable his judgments! And untraceable his ways!

content: 34 For who hath come to know the mind of the Lord? Or who hath become his counsellor?
content_old: 34 For who hath come to know the mind of the Lord? Or who hath become his counsellor?

content: 35 Or who hath first given unto him､ and it shall be recompensed to him again?
content_old: 35 Or who hath first given unto him､ and it shall be recompensed to him again?

content: 1 I beseech you therefore､ brethren､ through the compassions of God, To present your bodies a living､ holy sacrifice, unto God acceptable,— Your rational divine service;
content_old: 1 I beseech you therefore､ brethren､ through the compassions of God, To present your bodies a living､ holy sacrifice, unto God acceptable,— Your rational divine service;

content: 2 And be not configuring yourselves unto this age､ But be transforming yourselves by the renewing of your mind､ To the end ye may be proving what is the thing willed by God—the good and acceptable and perfect.
content_old: 2 And be not configuring yourselves unto this age､ But be transforming yourselves by the renewing of your mind､ To the end ye may be proving what is the thing willed by God—the good and acceptable and perfect.

content: 3 For I say Through the favour which hath been given me Unto every one who is among you,— Not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, But so to think as to think soberly— As unto each one God hath dealt a measure of faith.
content_old: 3 For I say Through the favour which hath been given me Unto every one who is among you,— Not to think of himself more highly than he ought to think, But so to think as to think soberly— As unto each one God hath dealt a measure of faith.

content: 4 For just as in one body we have many members､ Yet all the members have not the same office
content_old: 4 For just as in one body we have many members､ Yet all the members have not the same office

content: 5 So we､ the many are one body in Christ､ Yet severally members one of another.
content_old: 5 So we､ the many are one body in Christ､ Yet severally members one of another.

content: 6 Now having gifts of favour according to the favour given unto us differing— Whether prophesying let us use it according to the proportion of our faith,
content_old: 6 Now having gifts of favour according to the favour given unto us differing— Whether prophesying let us use it according to the proportion of our faith,

content: 7 Or ministering use it in our ministering, Or he that teacheth let him use his gift in his teaching,
content_old: 7 Or ministering use it in our ministering, Or he that teacheth let him use his gift in his teaching,

content: 8 Or he that exhorteth in his exhorting, He that impartethlet it be with liberality, He that taketh a lead with diligence, He that sheweth mercy with cheerfulness.
content_old: 8 Or he that exhorteth in his exhorting, He that impartethlet it be with liberality, He that taketh a lead with diligence, He that sheweth mercy with cheerfulness.

content: 9 Your love be without hypocrisy,— Loathing that which is wicked, Cleaving to that which is good;
content_old: 9 Your love be without hypocrisy,— Loathing that which is wicked, Cleaving to that which is good;

content: 10 In your brotherly love unto one another being tenderly affectioned, In honour unto one another giving preference;
content_old: 10 In your brotherly love unto one another being tenderly affectioned, In honour unto one another giving preference;

content: 11 In business not slothful, In spirit fervent, To the Lord doing service,
content_old: 11 In business not slothful, In spirit fervent, To the Lord doing service,

content: 12 In hope rejoicing, In tribulation enduring, In prayer persevering,
content_old: 12 In hope rejoicing, In tribulation enduring, In prayer persevering,

content: 13 With the needs of the saints having fellowship,— Hospitality pursuing.
content_old: 13 With the needs of the saints having fellowship,— Hospitality pursuing.

content: 14 Bless them that persecute, Bless､ and do not curse.
content_old: 14 Bless them that persecute, Bless､ and do not curse.

content: 15 Rejoice with them that rejoice, Weep with them that weep:
content_old: 15 Rejoice with them that rejoice, Weep with them that weep:

content: 16 The same thing one to another regarding,— Not the lofty things regarding, But by the lowly being led along. Be not getting presumptuous in your own opinion:
content_old: 16 The same thing one to another regarding,— Not the lofty things regarding, But by the lowly being led along. Be not getting presumptuous in your own opinion:

content: 17 Unto no one evil for evil rendering: Providing honourable things before all men:
content_old: 17 Unto no one evil for evil rendering: Providing honourable things before all men:

content: 18 If possible—so far as dependeth on you with all men being at peace:
content_old: 18 If possible—so far as dependeth on you with all men being at peace:

content: 19 Not avenging yourselves､ beloved､ but give place unto their anger; For it is written— Mine is avenging, I will recompense;—saith the Lord;
content_old: 19 Not avenging yourselves､ beloved､ but give place unto their anger; For it is written— Mine is avenging, I will recompense;—saith the Lord;

content: 20 But— If thine enemy hunger be feeding him, If he thirst be giving him drink; For this doing coals of fire shalt thou heap upon his head.
content_old: 20 But— If thine enemy hunger be feeding him, If he thirst be giving him drink; For this doing coals of fire shalt thou heap upon his head.

content: 1 Let every soul unto protecting authorities be in subjection; For there is no authority､ save by God, And they that are in being have by God been arranged,—
content_old: 1 Let every soul unto protecting authorities be in subjection; For there is no authority､ save by God, And they that are in being have by God been arranged,—

content: 2 So that he who rangeth himself against the authority Against the arrangement of God opposeth himself, And they who oppose shall unto themselves a sentence of judgment receive.
content_old: 2 So that he who rangeth himself against the authority Against the arrangement of God opposeth himself, And they who oppose shall unto themselves a sentence of judgment receive.

content: 3 For they who bear rule are not a terror unto the good work､ but unto the evil. Wouldst thou not be afraid of the authority? That which is good be thou doing､ and thou shalt have praise of the same;
content_old: 3 For they who bear rule are not a terror unto the good work､ but unto the evil. Wouldst thou not be afraid of the authority? That which is good be thou doing､ and thou shalt have praise of the same;

content: 4 For God’s minister is he unto thee､ for that which is good. But if that which is evil thou be doing be afraid! For not in vain the sword he beareth; For God’s minister he is,—an avenger､ unto anger､ to him who practiseth what is evil.
content_old: 4 For God’s minister is he unto thee､ for that which is good. But if that which is evil thou be doing be afraid! For not in vain the sword he beareth; For God’s minister he is,—an avenger､ unto anger､ to him who practiseth what is evil.

content: 5 Wherefore it is necessary to be in subjection,— Not only because of the anger, But also because of the conscience;
content_old: 5 Wherefore it is necessary to be in subjection,— Not only because of the anger, But also because of the conscience;

content: 6 For because of this are ye paying tribute also,— For God’s ministers of state they are､Unto this very thing giving constant attendance.
content_old: 6 For because of this are ye paying tribute also,— For God’s ministers of state they are､Unto this very thing giving constant attendance.

content: 7 Render unto all their dues,— Unto whom tribute tribute､ Unto whom tax tax, Unto whom fear fear､ Unto whom honour honour.
content_old: 7 Render unto all their dues,— Unto whom tribute tribute､ Unto whom tax tax, Unto whom fear fear､ Unto whom honour honour.

content: 8 Nothing､ to any be owing—save to be loving one another; For he that loveth his neighbour hath given to law its fulfilment.
content_old: 8 Nothing､ to any be owing—save to be loving one another; For he that loveth his neighbour hath given to law its fulfilment.

content: 9 For this— Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not commit murder, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not covet,— And if there is any different commandment In this word is summed up, namely— Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.
content_old: 9 For this— Thou shalt not commit adultery, Thou shalt not commit murder, Thou shalt not steal, Thou shalt not covet,— And if there is any different commandment In this word is summed up, namely— Thou shalt love thy neighbour as thyself.

content: 10 Love unto one’s neighbour worketh not ill; Law’s fulness therefore､ is Love.
content_old: 10 Love unto one’s neighbour worketh not ill; Law’s fulness therefore､ is Love.

content: 11 And this besides— Knowing the season— That it is an hour already for you out of sleep to be wakened; For now is our salvation nearer､ than when we believed:
content_old: 11 And this besides— Knowing the season— That it is an hour already for you out of sleep to be wakened; For now is our salvation nearer､ than when we believed:

content: 12 The night is far spent､ And the day hath drawn near; Let us､ then､ cast off the works of darkness, And let us put on the armour of light,—
content_old: 12 The night is far spent､ And the day hath drawn near; Let us､ then､ cast off the works of darkness, And let us put on the armour of light,—

content: 13 As in daytime becomingly let us walk: Not in revellings､ and in drunken bouts, Not in chamberings､ and in wanton deeds, Not in strife､ and envy;—
content_old: 13 As in daytime becomingly let us walk: Not in revellings､ and in drunken bouts, Not in chamberings､ and in wanton deeds, Not in strife､ and envy;—

content: 1 Him that is weak in his faith receive ye,—Not for disputing opinions:—
content_old: 1 Him that is weak in his faith receive ye,—Not for disputing opinions:—

content: 2 One indeed､ hath faith to eat all things, Whereas he that is weak eateth herbs:
content_old: 2 One indeed､ hath faith to eat all things, Whereas he that is weak eateth herbs:

content: 3 Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not, And let not him that eateth not judge him that eateth; For God hath received him.
content_old: 3 Let not him that eateth despise him that eateth not, And let not him that eateth not judge him that eateth; For God hath received him.

content: 4 Who art thou, that judgest another’s domestic? To his own master he standeth､ or falleth; He shall､ however､ be made to stand,— For his Master is able to make him stand.
content_old: 4 Who art thou, that judgest another’s domestic? To his own master he standeth､ or falleth; He shall､ however､ be made to stand,— For his Master is able to make him stand.

content: 5 For one indeed､ esteemeth one day beyond another, Whereas another esteemeth every day:— Let each one in his own mind be fully persuaded.
content_old: 5 For one indeed､ esteemeth one day beyond another, Whereas another esteemeth every day:— Let each one in his own mind be fully persuaded.

content: 6 He that regardeth the day Unto the Lord regardeth it,— And he that eateth Unto the Lord doth eat, For he giveth thanks unto God; And he that eateth not Unto the Lord doth not eat､ and give God thanks.
content_old: 6 He that regardeth the day Unto the Lord regardeth it,— And he that eateth Unto the Lord doth eat, For he giveth thanks unto God; And he that eateth not Unto the Lord doth not eat､ and give God thanks.

content: 7 For none of us unto himself liveth, And none unto himself dieth;
content_old: 7 For none of us unto himself liveth, And none unto himself dieth;

content: 8 For both if we live Unto the Lord we live, And if we die Unto the Lord we die; Whether therefore we live､ Or whether we die we are; The Lord’s
content_old: 8 For both if we live Unto the Lord we live, And if we die Unto the Lord we die; Whether therefore we live､ Or whether we die we are; The Lord’s

content: 9 For to this end Christ died and lived, In order that both of dead and living he might have lordship.
content_old: 9 For to this end Christ died and lived, In order that both of dead and living he might have lordship.

content: 10 But thou why dost thou judge thy brother? Aye! and thou why dost thou despise thy brother? For all of us shall present ourselves unto the judgment seat of God;
content_old: 10 But thou why dost thou judge thy brother? Aye! and thou why dost thou despise thy brother? For all of us shall present ourselves unto the judgment seat of God;

content: 11 For it is written— Living am I､ saith the Lord Unto me shall bow every knee, And every tongue shall openly confess unto God.
content_old: 11 For it is written— Living am I､ saith the Lord Unto me shall bow every knee, And every tongue shall openly confess unto God.

content: 12 Hence､ then, each one of us of himself shall give account unto God.
content_old: 12 Hence､ then, each one of us of himself shall give account unto God.

content: 13 No longer then､ upon one another let us be sitting in judgment, But this judge ye､ rather— Not to be putting a cause of stumbling before your brother､ or an occasion to fall.
content_old: 13 No longer then､ upon one another let us be sitting in judgment, But this judge ye､ rather— Not to be putting a cause of stumbling before your brother､ or an occasion to fall.

content: 14 I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus— That nothing is profane of itself,— Save to him who reckoneth anything to be profane, Unto that man it is profane.
content_old: 14 I know and am persuaded in the Lord Jesus— That nothing is profane of itself,— Save to him who reckoneth anything to be profane, Unto that man it is profane.

content: 15 If､ in fact､ because of food thy brother is being grieved No longer､ by the rule of love art thou walking:— Do not by thy food that man be destroying､ on whose behalf Christ died!
content_old: 15 If､ in fact､ because of food thy brother is being grieved No longer､ by the rule of love art thou walking:— Do not by thy food that man be destroying､ on whose behalf Christ died!

content: 16 Therefore､ suffer not to be defamed､ your own good thing;
content_old: 16 Therefore､ suffer not to be defamed､ your own good thing;

content: 17 For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, But righteousness and peace and joy in Holy Spirit;
content_old: 17 For the kingdom of God is not eating and drinking, But righteousness and peace and joy in Holy Spirit;

content: 18 For he that in this doeth service unto the Christ Is acceptable unto God､ And approved unto men.
content_old: 18 For he that in this doeth service unto the Christ Is acceptable unto God､ And approved unto men.

content: 19 Hence､ then､ the things pertaining to peace let us pursue, And the things which belong to the upbuilding one of another:
content_old: 19 Hence､ then､ the things pertaining to peace let us pursue, And the things which belong to the upbuilding one of another:

content: 20 Do not for the sake of food be throwing down the work of God! All things indeed､ are pure; But ill is it for the man who with occasion of stumbling doth eat,—
content_old: 20 Do not for the sake of food be throwing down the work of God! All things indeed､ are pure; But ill is it for the man who with occasion of stumbling doth eat,—

content: 21 Well is it､ not to eat flesh､ nor to drink wine､ nor to do aught whereby thy brother is caused to stumble.
content_old: 21 Well is it､ not to eat flesh､ nor to drink wine､ nor to do aught whereby thy brother is caused to stumble.

content: 22 The faith which thou hast have to thyself before God: Happy he that bringeth not judgment upon himself by that which he approveth;
content_old: 22 The faith which thou hast have to thyself before God: Happy he that bringeth not judgment upon himself by that which he approveth;

content: 1 We are bound､ however､ we､ who are strong The weakness of them who are not strong to be bearing, And not unto ourselves to give pleasure.
content_old: 1 We are bound､ however､ we､ who are strong The weakness of them who are not strong to be bearing, And not unto ourselves to give pleasure.

content: 2 Let each one of us unto his neighbour give pleasure— For what is good､ unto upbuilding;
content_old: 2 Let each one of us unto his neighbour give pleasure— For what is good､ unto upbuilding;

content: 3 For even the Christ not unto himself gave pleasure, But､ even as it is written— The reproaches of them that were reproaching thee fell upon me:—
content_old: 3 For even the Christ not unto himself gave pleasure, But､ even as it is written— The reproaches of them that were reproaching thee fell upon me:—

content: 4 Whatsoever things､ in fact､ were written aforetime All for our own instruction were written,— In order that through endurance､ and through the encouragement of the Scriptures we might have their hope.
content_old: 4 Whatsoever things､ in fact､ were written aforetime All for our own instruction were written,— In order that through endurance､ and through the encouragement of the Scriptures we might have their hope.

content: 5 Now may the God of the endurance､ and of the encouragement Give you the same thing to be regarding amongst one another､ according to Christ Jesus;
content_old: 5 Now may the God of the endurance､ and of the encouragement Give you the same thing to be regarding amongst one another､ according to Christ Jesus;

content: 6 In order that with one accord､ with one mouth ye may be glorifying the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
content_old: 6 In order that with one accord､ with one mouth ye may be glorifying the God and Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

content: 7 Wherefore receive ye one another, Even as Christ also hath received us unto the glory of God:—
content_old: 7 Wherefore receive ye one another, Even as Christ also hath received us unto the glory of God:—

content: 8 For I affirm Christ to have become a minister of circumcision､ In behalf of the truth of God,— To confirm the promises of the fathers,
content_old: 8 For I affirm Christ to have become a minister of circumcision､ In behalf of the truth of God,— To confirm the promises of the fathers,

content: 9 And that the nations for mercy should glorify God:— Even as it is written— For this cause will I openly confess unto thee among nations, And unto thy name will I strike the strings;
content_old: 9 And that the nations for mercy should glorify God:— Even as it is written— For this cause will I openly confess unto thee among nations, And unto thy name will I strike the strings;

content: 10 And again he saith— Be glad､ ye nations､ with his people;
content_old: 10 And again he saith— Be glad､ ye nations､ with his people;

content: 11 And again— Be giving praise､ all ye nations､ unto the Lord, And let all the peoples repeat his praise;
content_old: 11 And again— Be giving praise､ all ye nations､ unto the Lord, And let all the peoples repeat his praise;

content: 12 And again､ Isaiah saith— There shall be the root of Jesse, And he that ariseth to rule nations,— Upon him shall nations hope.
content_old: 12 And again､ Isaiah saith— There shall be the root of Jesse, And he that ariseth to rule nations,— Upon him shall nations hope.

content: 13 Now the God of the hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, So that ye may surpass in the hope､ In the power of Holy Spirit.
content_old: 13 Now the God of the hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, So that ye may surpass in the hope､ In the power of Holy Spirit.

content: 14 But I am persuaded､ my brethren,— Even I myself concerning you: That ye yourselves also､ are Full of goodness, Filled with all knowledge, Able also unto one another to be ministering admonition:
content_old: 14 But I am persuaded､ my brethren,— Even I myself concerning you: That ye yourselves also､ are Full of goodness, Filled with all knowledge, Able also unto one another to be ministering admonition:

content: 15 Howbeit the more boldly have I written unto you,— In some measure､ as bringing it back to your minds,— By reason of the favour given unto me from God,—
content_old: 15 Howbeit the more boldly have I written unto you,— In some measure､ as bringing it back to your minds,— By reason of the favour given unto me from God,—

content: 16 That I should be a public minister of Christ Jesus unto the nations, Doing priestly service with the glad-message of God, In order that the offering up of the nations might prove to be acceptable, Being hallowed in Holy Spirit:
content_old: 16 That I should be a public minister of Christ Jesus unto the nations, Doing priestly service with the glad-message of God, In order that the offering up of the nations might prove to be acceptable, Being hallowed in Holy Spirit:

content: 17 I have､ therefore､ my boasting in Christ Jesus､ in the things pertaining to God,—
content_old: 17 I have､ therefore､ my boasting in Christ Jesus､ in the things pertaining to God,—

content: 18 For I will not dare to speak anything Save of the things which Christ hath wrought out for himself through me､ for the obedience of nations,— By word and deed､
content_old: 18 For I will not dare to speak anything Save of the things which Christ hath wrought out for himself through me､ for the obedience of nations,— By word and deed､

content: 19 By the power of signs and wonders､ By the power of Holy Spirit; So that I from Jerusalem and in a circuit as far as Illyricum have fulfilled the glad-message of the Christ,—
content_old: 19 By the power of signs and wonders､ By the power of Holy Spirit; So that I from Jerusalem and in a circuit as far as Illyricum have fulfilled the glad-message of the Christ,—

content: 20 Although thus—as ambitious to be announcing the glad-message,— Not where Christ had been named, Lest upon another’s foundation I should be building;
content_old: 20 Although thus—as ambitious to be announcing the glad-message,— Not where Christ had been named, Lest upon another’s foundation I should be building;

content: 21 But､ even as it is written— They shall see､ unto whom had been announced no tidings concerning him, And they who had not heard shall understand.
content_old: 21 But､ even as it is written— They shall see､ unto whom had been announced no tidings concerning him, And they who had not heard shall understand.

content: 22 Wherefore､ also､ I have been hindered､ these many times､ from coming unto you;
content_old: 22 Wherefore､ also､ I have been hindered､ these many times､ from coming unto you;

content: 23 But now no longer having place in these regions, And having had a longing to come unto you､ a good many years—
content_old: 23 But now no longer having place in these regions, And having had a longing to come unto you､ a good many years—

content: 24 As soon as I am journeying to Spain— I am hoping､ in fact､ when journeying through to get sight of you, And by you to be set forward thither,—If with your company I have first in some measure been satisfied.
content_old: 24 As soon as I am journeying to Spain— I am hoping､ in fact､ when journeying through to get sight of you, And by you to be set forward thither,—If with your company I have first in some measure been satisfied.

content: 25 But now I am journeying unto Jerusalem､ ministering unto the saints;
content_old: 25 But now I am journeying unto Jerusalem､ ministering unto the saints;

content: 26 For Macedonia and Achaia have been well-pleased to make a certain fellowship for the destitute of the saints who are in Jerusalem,—
content_old: 26 For Macedonia and Achaia have been well-pleased to make a certain fellowship for the destitute of the saints who are in Jerusalem,—

content: 27 They have been well-pleased､ indeed､— And their debtors they are; For if with their spiritual things the nations have come into fellowship They are bound also with their own carnal things to minister publicly unto them.
content_old: 27 They have been well-pleased､ indeed､— And their debtors they are; For if with their spiritual things the nations have come into fellowship They are bound also with their own carnal things to minister publicly unto them.

content: 28 This then､ having completed､ and sealed unto them this fruit I will come back､ by you､ unto Spain:—
content_old: 28 This then､ having completed､ and sealed unto them this fruit I will come back､ by you､ unto Spain:—

content: 29 And I know that when I come unto you In the fulness of the blessing of Christ I shall come.
content_old: 29 And I know that when I come unto you In the fulness of the blessing of Christ I shall come.

content: 30 I beseech you､ moreover､ brethren, Through our Lord Jesus Christ, And through the love of the Spirit To strive together with me､ in your prayers on my behalf unto God,—
content_old: 30 I beseech you､ moreover､ brethren, Through our Lord Jesus Christ, And through the love of the Spirit To strive together with me､ in your prayers on my behalf unto God,—

content: 31 In order that I may be delivered from them who do not yield in Judæa, And my ministry which is unto Jerusalem may prove to be acceptable unto the saints;
content_old: 31 In order that I may be delivered from them who do not yield in Judæa, And my ministry which is unto Jerusalem may prove to be acceptable unto the saints;

content: 32 In order that with joy coming unto you through God’s will I may together with you find rest.
content_old: 32 In order that with joy coming unto you through God’s will I may together with you find rest.

content: 1 And I commend to you Phæbe､ our sister,— Being a minister also of the assembly which is in Cenchreæ;
content_old: 1 And I commend to you Phæbe､ our sister,— Being a minister also of the assembly which is in Cenchreæ;

content: 2 In order that ye may give her welcome､ in the Lord､ in a manner worthy of the saints, And stand by her in any matter wherein she may have need of you; For she also hath proved to be a defender of many, and of my own self.
content_old: 2 In order that ye may give her welcome､ in the Lord､ in a manner worthy of the saints, And stand by her in any matter wherein she may have need of you; For she also hath proved to be a defender of many, and of my own self.

content: 3 Salute ye Prisca and Aquila､ my fellow-workers in Christ Jesus,—
content_old: 3 Salute ye Prisca and Aquila､ my fellow-workers in Christ Jesus,—

content: 4 Who indeed､ for my life their own neck laid down,— Unto whom—not I only give thanks､ but also all the assemblies of the nations;
content_old: 4 Who indeed､ for my life their own neck laid down,— Unto whom—not I only give thanks､ but also all the assemblies of the nations;

content: 5 Salute also the assembly at their house. Salute ye Epænetus､ my beloved, Who is a first-fruit of Asia unto Christ.
content_old: 5 Salute also the assembly at their house. Salute ye Epænetus､ my beloved, Who is a first-fruit of Asia unto Christ.

content: 6 Salute Mary— Who indeed､ hath toiled much for you.
content_old: 6 Salute Mary— Who indeed､ hath toiled much for you.

content: 7 Salute Andronicus and Junias､ my kinsmen and my fellow-captives, Who indeed､ are of note among the Apostles､ Who also before me had come to be in Christ.
content_old: 7 Salute Andronicus and Junias､ my kinsmen and my fellow-captives, Who indeed､ are of note among the Apostles､ Who also before me had come to be in Christ.

content: 8 Salute Ampliatus､ my beloved in the Lord.
content_old: 8 Salute Ampliatus､ my beloved in the Lord.

content: 9 Salute Urbanus､ our fellow-worker in Christ; And Stachys､ my beloved.
content_old: 9 Salute Urbanus､ our fellow-worker in Christ; And Stachys､ my beloved.

content: 10 Salute Apelles､ the approved in Christ. Salute them of the household of Aristobulus.
content_old: 10 Salute Apelles､ the approved in Christ. Salute them of the household of Aristobulus.

content: 11 Salute Herodion､ my kinsman. Salute them of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.
content_old: 11 Salute Herodion､ my kinsman. Salute them of the household of Narcissus who are in the Lord.

content: 12 Salute Tryphæna and Tryphosa､ sisters who have toiled in the Lord. Salute Persis､ the beloved sister, Who indeed､ hath toiled much in the Lord.
content_old: 12 Salute Tryphæna and Tryphosa､ sisters who have toiled in the Lord. Salute Persis､ the beloved sister, Who indeed､ hath toiled much in the Lord.

content: 13 Salute Rufus､ The chosen in the Lord; Also his and my mother.
content_old: 13 Salute Rufus､ The chosen in the Lord; Also his and my mother.

content: 14 Salute Asyncritus､ Phlegon､ Hermes､ Patrobas､ Hermas, And the brethren that are with them.
content_old: 14 Salute Asyncritus､ Phlegon､ Hermes､ Patrobas､ Hermas, And the brethren that are with them.

content: 15 Salute Philologus and Julia､ Nereus and his sister､ and Olympas, And all the saints that are with them.
content_old: 15 Salute Philologus and Julia､ Nereus and his sister､ and Olympas, And all the saints that are with them.

content: 16 Salute ye one another､ with a holy kiss. All the assemblies of the Christ salute you.
content_old: 16 Salute ye one another､ with a holy kiss. All the assemblies of the Christ salute you.

content: 17 But I beseech you､ brethren､ To keep an eye upon them who are causing divisions and occasions of stumbling､ aside from the teaching which ye have learned,— And be turning away from them;
content_old: 17 But I beseech you､ brethren､ To keep an eye upon them who are causing divisions and occasions of stumbling､ aside from the teaching which ye have learned,— And be turning away from them;

content: 18 For they who are such unto our Lord Christ are not doing service､ but unto their own belly,— And through their smooth and flattering speech deceive the hearts of the innocent.
content_old: 18 For they who are such unto our Lord Christ are not doing service､ but unto their own belly,— And through their smooth and flattering speech deceive the hearts of the innocent.

content: 19 For your obedience unto all hath reached,— Over you therefore､ I rejoice! But I wish you— To be wise､ indeed､ as to that which is good, Yet pure､ as to that which is evil.
content_old: 19 For your obedience unto all hath reached,— Over you therefore､ I rejoice! But I wish you— To be wise､ indeed､ as to that which is good, Yet pure､ as to that which is evil.

content: 20 Howbeit the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly. The favour of our Lord Jesus be with you.
content_old: 20 Howbeit the God of peace will crush Satan under your feet shortly. The favour of our Lord Jesus be with you.

content: 21 There salute you—Timothy､ my fellow-worker, And Lucius､ and Jason､ and Sosipater､ my kinsmen.
content_old: 21 There salute you—Timothy､ my fellow-worker, And Lucius､ and Jason､ and Sosipater､ my kinsmen.

content: 22 I Tertius､ who have written the epistle､ salute you in the Lord.
content_old: 22 I Tertius､ who have written the epistle､ salute you in the Lord.

content: 23 There saluteth you—Gaius､ my host and the host of the whole assembly. There salute you—Erastus､ the steward of the city, and Quartus the brother.
content_old: 23 There saluteth you—Gaius､ my host and the host of the whole assembly. There salute you—Erastus､ the steward of the city, and Quartus the brother.

content: 25 Now unto him who hath power to establish you､ According to my glad-message—Even the proclamation of Jesus Christ, According to the revelation of a sacred secret､ In age-past times kept silent､
content_old: 25 Now unto him who hath power to establish you､ According to my glad-message—Even the proclamation of Jesus Christ, According to the revelation of a sacred secret､ In age-past times kept silent､

content: 26 But now made manifest, And through means of prophetic scriptures､ According to the command of the age-abiding God､ For obedience of faith unto all the nations made known
content_old: 26 But now made manifest, And through means of prophetic scriptures､ According to the command of the age-abiding God､ For obedience of faith unto all the nations made known
